title: Children's Field Guide Text font
content:
Any recommendations for a text font for a children’s (6–12) field guide?

 [‹ Does anybody Know?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144151/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31855 "Go to previous forum topic") [Interesting signage typography from "Idiocracy" ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144151/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31863 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Ehague

comments.content: Interesting. A field guide to what? Perhaps [Sassoon](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144151/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Sassoon). Read more about it at [Club Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144151/http:/www.clubtype.co.uk/).

@ Stephen

Why do you think Sassoon is “a typeface for children”, and not e.g. Bembo for example?

\>6-12  
is a very wide range because (this) 6 years show extreme differences in the development of children.

_Why do you think Sassoon is “a typeface for children”_

Because it “was designed to be used in children’s books. It was designed for Linotype in 1988 by Adrian Williams and calligrapher Rosemary Sassoon.” \*

\* From Addison-Wesley’s _The Postscript Font Handbook, Revised Edition_, 1992.

Everyone can claim that ;) – does it mean a soft and curvy (scriptlike) and “simplistic” sans is a better read for small children (which are beginners)? Or is a proofed antiqua like Bembo, the better way to go?  
That was my question.
Have a look at the link Stephen posted: it’s got all the answers to your questions (and more!).

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144151im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/BWL_4431.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144151im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/BWLpage_4616.jpg)

I collected Brooke Bond tea cards when I was a child (although I didn’t drink tea...)  
This was 1959, so I was seven. The text type is 7 pt Plantin — the same face now used in Monocle, BTW.

Nice Nick! And there’s also a [Schoolbook](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144151/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=M.9230.0.0) version of Plantin which [Wallpaper](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821144151/http:/typographi.com/000490.php) used quite affectively a few years ago.

My son is younger, and likes to read.  
The books he’s recently borrowed and read by himself have been set in:

Bembo, Garamond (Adobe and Berthold), Weiss, Veljovic, NC Schoolbook, and Palatino. Usually in big sizes.

To be honest, he doesn’t care about the typeface.

\>Bembo, Garamond (Adobe and Berthold), Weiss, Veljovic, NC Schoolbook, and Palatino. Usually in big sizes.

Weiss – Which book, i’m interested?
